summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 9, 2019. It records inmate movements, status changes (e.g., admissions, releases, bail/bond, hospital transfers), and cell assignments. The log is significant as it documents the facility's operations on the day Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Bureau of Prisons daily log records inmate movements, status changes (admissions, releases, bail/bond, hospital transfers), and cell reassignments at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York (implied by NYM facility codes)
keyFacts: This is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) daily inmate movement log from the MCC New York facility.
The log is dated August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at this facility.
The document records routine inmate activities including admissions, releases, bail/bond processing, hospital transfers, and cell changes.
The log does not contain any entries explicitly for Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting his status may have been logged separately or this is a partial log.
The document originates from the BOP's SENTRY system and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
